comment: honestly dont take this professor. She almost never responds to emails and she waits until the last second to grade.  she grades assignments badly even if you followed all criteria. I literally dont even know my grade because she hasnt graded half the things ive submitted or graded them poorly to the point where ive had to email her. dont take her

It's the end of the semester and she still hasn't graded half of my assignments and discussions I submitted. She's very vague on assignment instructions and doesn't respond to emails. The exams are lock down but no webcam, there's a legal brief and an ethical case study assignment that genuinely made me want to rip my hair out. Take with risk.

Did not reply to emails at all. Also, sometimes you wouldn't know what do to because she does not post the rubric for an assignment. Does not give you grades until the very last minute. DO NOT TAKE HER.

Please pick another professor. She does not give grades out. For example, you do discussions that help you for a big assignment. She gave us grades for those discussions weeks after the assignment was due, so you never got feedback. She would also take away lots of points for small things. I used the wrong terminology once and got a 55 as the grade
DO NOT TAKE. this professor does not reply to emails whatsoever. She

This course is really what you make it. Please go to class because your grade will be a reflection of whether or not you paid attention. She is very kind, but you don't want to take her kindness for granted because just like you're there to learn, she's there to be paid.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: super understanding and helpful as long as you talked to her. Mostly graded by a few bigger assignments, but she would always work with you if you needed help. She has a very kind soul just be open and honest with her. she cares a lot about her students

If you're a student who wants to to track your grade throughout the semester, choose otherwise. 95% of grades went in after finals. This class isn't overly difficult, and the large projects were easy to comprehend and complete. Modules went live each Monday, but no info was posted about some modules for days after. Do your work and you'll be fine.

Seemed like she didn't know how to navigate public speaking from an online perspective. None of the work had anything to do with public speaking. The class should be called Intro to LinkedIn, that's what we learned instead. Work was harshly graded; I literally failed an introduction post. I ended up withdrawing, the class was not worth the effort.

I highly recommend you do not take this course with Professor Sichler if you at any point want to know what grade you have at any given time. She just added a final and emailed us about it the day before it was due. There is no notice prior and she does not put in grades at any point during the semester. Don't take the class, thank me later.
Professor Sichler simply doesn't grade your work. I went through basically the whole semester with tons of blogs posted and no feedback. Other than that shes solid.

I wouldn't recommend this professor if your a student who needs more explanation on an assignment. Or if you are a student who likes to see their grades on their assignments. Semester is almost over and she still hasn't posted grades for almost half of the assignments we have done. Nor has she responded to my emails. DON'T RECOMMEND.

Ms. Sichler is by far one of the most easy-going professors I've had. Taking Public Speaking with her was honestly a class I looked forward to going to every day. She gives great feedback for speeches and follows the rubric word for word. She made the class environment very laid back- would definitely take this class again.

If you are interested in a career in media, definitely take her class. The projects aren't overly difficult and force you to look into the career you are interested in. It even helped me make a professional connection in the field I am pursuing that I am very happy to have made. Genuinely loved this class.

This class was okay. There were 4 tests that were lockdown with cam and they were pretty difficult, but you get to use 1 page of notes. There are blog posts every week, but out of the 8 week semester, you only had to complete 5. We had I think 2 extra credit assignments. Study and do your blog posts on time and you should be good.
3 group projects but not too bad.

one of the worst teachers Ive had at ksu. She test you every week and tells you what shes testing you on in the middle of the week which is not much time to study. She graded really hard on the blogs and doesnt make it clear on what she wants. You dont get a response on the weekends. I learned nothing from this class WASTE OF TIME

Professor Sichler is very kind and understanding and listened to our feedback. The assignments were a lot of work and each week we had to make a blog post but overall if you do your work its not bad. My only complaint is that at the end of the semester we only have around 4-6 grades in. I prefer knowing how my grades are doing during the semester.

She is fantastic! She really cares about her students and makes the class interesting. She is readily available and provides lots of extra credit and opportunities to meet with her. I would take any class of hers again. It was the best kind of challenging without feeling like an obnoxious burden.

COM2020 Sources/Invest. *online*--easy A!, no attendance, no textbook required(she posts pages online needed for a grade), no actual writing help or help with the semester long research paper, EXTREMELY hard to communicate with-she does NOT answer emails timely/if at all-this is a filler class do NOT take with Sichler if you need writing help!!!

save yourself the time and money and DO NOT TAKE HER. she is the worst prof i have EVER had. if she is the last professor available wait to take the class with someone else. we had maybe 5 classes she didnt cancel, never was on topic, didnt know what she was talking about. class average on tests was always 68 or less. she was HORRIBLE.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: WORST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD! Do yourself a favor and never take her. She is terrible at lectures and is really just not a nice person. Her powerpoints are terrible and she does not seem like she knows what she's talking about most of the time.

Prof. Sichler is one of the nicest, most caring professors I've taken. The class overall is hard - a lot of things to study and remember and exams are usually lockdown, but she goes out of her way to help students prepare. She offers extra credit. The course schedule does change a lot though, so be prepared for that. Overall though, she's great.

I loved Professor Sichler. She was a tough professor, but she was very helpful when you asked for it. She lectures the whole class then you have tests at home on lockdown. She allows you to use your notes for tests. I recommend creating an outline of notes from her lectures then filling them in when she lectures. That's how I aced every test.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Avoid this professor! You need to know every word she says in class to pass, her powerpoints don't help. The test are fill in blank and use lockdown browser. She cancelled class at least 4 times the last half of the semester therefore we did not cover the material before final. Not a lot of work, 1 paper and 4 exams.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I would not recommend taking Professor Sichler. She is a very nice person, however her teaching is lacking. She spends a lot of lecture time on things that are not important and then tests students on 120 pages of out-of-class reading that was never mentioned. She also makes tests fill-in-the-blank that have very ambiguous answers.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Professor Sichler is very knowledgeable in her field and definitely makes you work for an A. Attendance is mandatory, but you get 3 absences. You HAVE to take notes over her lectures because test questions are heavily based on lectures. Tests are on lockdown browser, but they're open note. So as long as you take good notes, you will be fine.

Professor Sichler is a very nice and intelligent woman, however, her tests are the hardest tests I have encountered thus far. She is also slow to put in grades, so if you are borderline it can cause a lot of worry. With that being said, she is understanding and willing to help you if you put in the effort.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Sichler is probably the most interesting woman I've ever met. She's very quirky, but extremely smart. Definitely take notes on everything that comes out of her mouth, even if it doesn't seem important. Tests are with a lock-down browser + webcam, but you get 5 pages of notes front and back, and there's always a freebee question.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Sichler is one of my all time favorite professors. She offers lectures that are super interesting, and her insane intelligence shows. She's not an easy A, but participate often and study lightly for your tests and you'll be fine. She respects students who participate in class, so be sure to interject whenever you can. She's very understanding, too.

This class was slightly unorganized. There were 6 tests on lockdown browser + webcam, BUT you could use notes. The main thing I did not like was how slow she was grading. Her lectures slowly stopped as the semester progressed, so the tests became more unclear. I wouldn't say not to take her, I would just say be careful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I def suggest using her office hours and putting yourself on her radar. Her lectures are easy to follow & taking notes is a must.

She may seem really tough at first but when you finally get to know her grading style, it isn't so bad. She grades by few things, like a theory paper for the final assignment, but you can choose a partner. Don't slack and you shouldn't fall behind. She is also very understanding and helpful so don't be afraid to ask.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: At first, Prof. Sichler seemed tough but as the semester went on she really warmed up. She's a great prof. and very knowledgeable. The class is hard, but she breaks the workload down pretty evenly throughout the semester. Prof. Sichler is fun and understanding. She's also super helpful one-on-one if you get stuck during the semester. Two thumbs up!

Professor Sicher is such a kind person. She relates to you & understands that her class is not the only class you're taking. Her class is consumed with lectures & you have 3 assignments along with 4 lectures. As long as you pay attention to lectures & have the book, the tests are open notes/books, you should be fine. Great professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Sichler is a gem, she's hilarious, her tests are fill in the blank online, but if you have the book you will do fine. She also keeps the tests open for 3 days. She is an interesting conversationalist!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Sichler really enjoys theory. I found the class boring at times but she was good at sparking debates and making the class interesting. She is a tough grader on your literature review, but test are easy. You definitely need the book for the tests.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Sichler was awesome. She is very passionate about the subject and presents it in an interesting manner. She cracks jokes and even bakes. I enjoyed her class and wish she taught more courses I need.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Karen is honestly one of the best professors at KSU, yes she does have a strict technology, however, she makes that very clear in the beginning of the semester. Other than that, her lectures are interesting, she's extremely transparent, and if you talk with her one-on-one she's super nice and cool to talk to.  All exams are online & she does curve!

4 tests, quizzes for each chapter, 5 group assignments. Takes attendance like all Comm professors. Forgets to post the quizzes online, & said she'd open them back up but didn't even do that when she said she would. If you're on your phone or talking, she'll stand there & look at you. She's tolerable, BUT it takes her WEEKS to grade SCANTRON TESTS!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She treats her students like little kids. No technology what so ever. If she sees someone she will stop and call them out. She won't continue if people do not participate. Group work that is in class, but turned in online. Lots of online quizzes that you never know the due dates for. Study the online summaries for tests. Tests are easy.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She can come off abrasive when speaking to the class as a whole, but is incredibly caring if you come to her one-on-one. She is strict about phone use during her class, but as long as you keep your phone away this class should not be difficult for you
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Professor Sichler is honestly one of the least respectful professors I have taken in my class, she treats her classes with no respect and expects to get respect back from the class, thats not going to happen. Do not take.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Prof. Sichler was great but the concepts we talked about in class were very hard to understand. She tried but it went over my head and I got the feeling the rest of the class felt the same. The tests were open book (or open internet)and very passable. The research paper was tough but it was with a group so find good partners to leech off of.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Very understanding & will answer all of your emails quicklyto help you write your paper. You have one 5-7 page paper due at the end. You turn it in chunks at a time throughout the semester and she grades them and gives you feedback. If you don't like your grades it's okay because you turn in the revised paper at the end and she will replace them.
